body.name: Acer KC242Y Hbi 23.8" Full HD (1920 x 1080) Zero-Frame Gaming Office Monitor | AMD FreeSync Technology | 100Hz | 1ms (VRB) | Low Blue Light | Tilt | HDMI & VGA Ports,Black
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 5 hrs 40 mins
features: 23.8" Full HD (1920 x 1080) Monitor For Home, Gaming or Office
Response Time: 1ms VRB | Refresh Rate: 100Hz (Using HDMI Port) | Brightness: 250 nits | Pixel Pitch: 0.275mm
Ergonomic Tilt: -5° to 15° | VESA Mounting Compliant (100 x 100mm)
Ports: 1 x HDMI 1.4 Port & 1 x VGA Port (HDMI Cable Included)
body.description: In competitive gaming, every frame matters. Introducing Acer's KC242Y gaming monitor - the Full HD resolution monitor that can keep up with your game play. Through AMD FreeSync technology, the game’s frame rate is determined by your graphics card, not the fixed refresh rate of the monitor, giving you a serious competitive edge. Plus, users can enjoy comfortable viewing experience while gaming via flicker-less and low dimming display. The design saves space on your desk and lets you place multiple monitors side by side to build a seamless big-screen display. The remarkable 100 Million:1 contrast ratio ensures a crystal-clear viewing experience while rapid 1ms VRB response time keeps moving images sharp. It also supports HDMI & VGA inputs offering greater compatibility. (UM.QK2AA.H02)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Using with a MacBook Air, M2, through a USB-C hub to the monitor's HDMI. The picture is good enough and it serves my purposes as an office computer monitor well. It is very good for a reasonable price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Best picture quality for $90 while allowing 100hz for gaming. Very high quality for the price too!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Acer Has a Winner
reviews.reviewText: This monitor has a lot of great features for only $90!The picture is vivid and sharp.Auto turn on and off works perfectly.Easy to adjust color, brightness, and contrast.For the price, I don't think there's a better monitor out there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Amazing in the moment, but longevity is in question
reviews.reviewText: I was attracted to this product due to its promise of incredibly low input delay. Sure enough, I feel it! However, this does come at a price, that being lifespan concern. At least it is a relatively affordable price for a gaming monitor.I am using this with a Windows 10 gaming setup, and I can see that I'm supported for a refresh rate between 50hz and 100hz. At all times, I use a good amount of contrast, cooler colors, and a high value of black correction, which makes the monitor quite a ways brighter than I'd like, but ensures everything is far less blurry when things are in motion. (Such as scrolling screens, Windows desktop animations, and gaming.)During mundane browsing and office work, the screen is comfortable to use at all refresh rate levels. During gaming, however, you will run into an issue of unbearable motion blur. For example, I play Warframe, which is incredibly fast-paced and full of constant motion. The amount of unwanted blurring that this monitor can produce on its own is almost vomit-inducing, and I have been gaming all of my life. Yet, actually, this screen can absolutely handle the game, but it requires everything to be at the highest setting levels:Set your computer's refresh rate to 100hz, then fiddle with the monitor's built-in settings to switch on its "Over Drive." Use the buttons/knob on the back of its right side. Now, these two things combined will completely eliminate the monitor's issue of motion blur, as well as deepen the black colors to a perfect degree. (Also, the monitor allows for customizable "setting presets," which the monitor itself remembers. So it takes me all of five seconds to switch between screen intensities or refresh rates, meaning that pre-gaming and post-gaming has a low setup time, but still noticeably there.)Anyhow, the wording of that Over Drive feature is what bothers me. I'm overclocking my gaming monitor just to use it without bothersome motion blur? Does this mean that I'm putting my gaming monitor at risk of having a lower lifespan? That's quite worrying. But, I did only spend around $100 USD on this product, so the affordability does remain acceptable. Hence why I've docked stars towards screen quality, but the product is still overall a 4-star monitor. Powerful for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: For my budget, it is an excellent monitor that works really well and has really good picture quality, just note that since it is not an IPS display, dark colors can be shown badly

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Easy hook up. Quality picture. Use daily for stock charts and work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent for the price.
reviews.reviewText: This monitor is cheap. The display is definitely not great and I would not use this monitor for gaming. It works perfect as a second monitor for myself where I watch videos or have discord pulled up while my game is on another monitor. The screen has a light filter on it, not sure what you would call it, but essentially if you are not looking directly at the screen, it is darkened/discolored. So not the best for watching movies either. This is just a cheap monitor option. It is VGA mountable and I had no issues mounting it, also works vertical when mounted. The stand it comes with I have not used, but it looks big and bulky to me and would take up more space than I would want. Over all, for the price it is good but if you are looking for a strong gaming monitor for $50 more you can get much higher quality ones.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works well. Text and images are sharp. Goes into sleep mode to save energy. Happy with this product.

Necesitaba un monitor pequeño y este resultó ser una gran opción. Es práctico, la imagen se ve bien, aunque no lo recomendaría para juegos, solo para trabajo de oficina o escolar. Es un poco difícil configurarlo con el tipo de menú que trae, pero independiente de ese detalle, estoy bastante conforme por el precio.

Es un muy buen monitor.ProsEl equipo tiene buena respuesta y colores, lo puedes usar para ofimatica y gaming sin ningun problema.ContrasEl equipo tiene un brillo muy fuerte por lo cual para la noche si puede cansar, su material de fabricación se siente un poco malo y los botones sientes que se romperan en cualquier momento.ConclusionEl equipo es muy bueno y puede competir muy bien con algunos muy caros, por lo cual puede que no encuentres nada igual a menos que sea de uso.

Es un monitor de apariencia sencilla. No podría decir que sus materiales son malos, sin embargo tampoco son excelentes. La calidad de pantalla, que es lo que importa más, es buena. Estoy conforme con la relación calidad - precio. Llego a tiempo y en excelentes condiciones. Si lo recomendaría.

Nos gusto mucho el monito la imagen es de buena calidad, el tiempo de entrega adecuado, llego bien protegido en dos cajas, fácil de instalar aunque no trae el manual de usuario. Tamaña adecuado a nuestras necesidades, uso diario por varias horas sin cansarte la vista.
